Created attachment 504630
screenshot, verdana at 9px in chrome, trunk, ie9 beta

Taken from the reddit.com toppage, this text appears in the banner menu at the top of the page.

Attached is a screenshot showing the difference between Chrome, trunk and IE9 beta.  When D2D is disabled we render identically to Chrome.  Note how different the 'A' and 'C' glyphs are, this isn't just different advance widths being used.

This may well be a "wont't fix" but since Verdana is so common I wanted to make sure we verify that the difference is correct and not just a whoops of some sort.

comments.raw_text: I believe this is correct. What you're seeing in the GDI text is the effect of aggressive hinting that was designed to maximize on-screen legibility (sometimes sacrificing glyph design consistency in the course of grid-fitting the outline). The DW rendering, using subpixel positioning, stays much closer to the "ideal" glyph shapes. This isn't a bug, it is an improvement. :)

comments.text: Yeah, I'm not really arguing that it's less ideal, only that it's a relatively big change (in this case I'd say "dramatically different" would be the best description).  I think we probably just need to confirm that it's the hinting (e.g. test with a rebuilt font with no hinting) and, if so, mark this invalid and figure out how best to communicate this.
